name: entitlement
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ C or U ] something that you have a right to do or have, or the right to do or have something: pension/holiday entitlements Managers have generous leave entitlement.
[ U ] disapproving the feeling that you have the right to do or have what you want without having to work for it or deserve it, just because of who you are: a classic case of male entitlement

something, often a benefit from the government, that you have the right to have: [ U ] Social Security and Medicare are popular entitlement programs in the US.
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ U ]
  LAW, HR a situation in which you have the right to do or have something: Almost any job which a benefit recipient takes will have some effect upon his current entitlement to unemployment benefits.
[ C ]
  LAW, HR something that you have the right to do or have: Employee discount is seen as an entitlement and not necessarily a benefit.holiday/pension entitlement If online recruiters can be believed, 60% of British workers are failing to take their full holiday entitlement. All income and cash entitlements will be paid promptly into your account.
[ C ]
  GOVERNMENT
  US a type of financial help provided by the US government for members of a particular group: He warned the administration would face massive budget deficits unless it reduced the soaring costs of Social Security and other entitlements. Means testing is a necessary part of all our entitlement programs.
